Introduction
Professor of Agricultural Entomology, Forest Entomology, and IPM strategies. My research is based on studies of innovative IPM strategies to control the key pest of olive, tomato, hazelnut, chestnut, and vine phytophagous insects, alien insect species and on entomopathogenic fungus. I have experience of Helicoverpa armigera, Spodoptera littoralis and Bactrocera oleae, mass rearing. I have carried out teaching and researches in Argentine, Peru and Nepal.

Projects

Projects (8)
Stochastic models for plant protection
Project
Mathematics is not only a powerful tool in several scientific fields but she is, also, the language of Mother Nature (Luca Rossini).4 Objective: development of mathematical models to describe pest (insects, plant pathogens, weeds) populations and other biotic stressor considering their development through the life stages and over time.
View
EntoSim
Project
EntoSim is a C++ software which involves a series of different models to describe insect pests life cycle. In my PhD I'm focusing on the development of physiologically-based models to describe ectotherms life cycle. The process of development starts from the pure mathematical theory, until the validation with field data. The final goal is to understand and translate with mathematics the biological mechanisms and to provide helpful tools to farmers and technicians as decision support systems.
View
Hymenoptera Drynidae Taxonomy
Project
Under the supervision of Prof. Massimo Olmi this project focuses its attention on the taxonomy of Drynidae and other families of Chrysidoidea from different world regions. The aim of the project is to spread the knowledge of this particular family of Hymenoptera.
View
